did.unittitle: Institute for the Study of Mental Retardation and Related Disabilities (University of Michigan) records 1963-1983
did.abstract: Administrative files, conference proceedings, project proposals, research files, records, and photographs relating to continuing education conferences and workshops.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

did.physloc: Portions located in offsite storage; prior notification required for access.

acqinfo.p: The collection was transferred to the Bentley Library in June 1983, when the Institute closed. (Donor No. 6668)

accruals.p: Periodic additions to the records expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Institute for the Study of Mental Retardation and Related Disabilities (University of Michigan) records, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: In December 1963, the University of Michigan appointed a steering committee to appraise the University's role in the area of mental retardation. This committee began a comprehensive study of the University's interests and goals in this field. The subsequent report, dated June 1965, recommended the establishment of an interdisciplinary institute with a threefold purpose--to engage in research, to provide community clinical services, and to train students in the treatment of mental retardation. At the same time two laws were passed (Public Law 88-164, 1964 and Public Law 89-97, 1967) which provided potential financial support for university-affiliated centers for the treatment of the mentally retarded.

Thus in 1966, the Regents of the University of Michigan created the Institute for the Study of Mental Retardation (ISMR, later to become the Institute for the Study of Mental Retardation and Related Disabilities--ISMRRD). Administratively, ISMRRD came under the jurisdiction of the Vice-President for Academic Affairs. ISMRRD did not grant degrees, but rather cooperated with degree-programs in fifteen disciplines, including audiology, dentistry, instructional technology, nursing, nutrition, occupational therapy, pediatrics, physical therapy, psychiatry, rehabilitation counseling, social work, special education and speech pathology.

In 1982, the Budget Priorities Committee of the University of Michigan appointed a review committee to evaluate ISMRRD's program. The committee recommended that ISMRRD be closed, since it was the committee's contention that the Institute no longer excelled in any of its pursuits. Consequently ISMRRD was shut down in June 1983.

scopecontent.p: The records of the Institute consist of forty-nine linear feet of manuscripts and printed materials. The records date form 1965 to 1983. The record group is divided into four broad Series: Administrative Files (boxes 1-7), Research Files (boxes 8-18), Continuing Education (boxes 19-48), and Photographs (box 49). Of these, only the Administrative Files have been closely processed. The Administration Files are divided into several subseries, the most substantive of which are History of ISMRRD, Committees, Institute Reviews, and Projects, Proposals and Reports.

controlaccess.head: Subjects:
controlaccess.corpname: University of Michigan. Institute for the Study of Mental Retardation and Related Disabilities.
controlaccess.subject: People with mental disabilities.
Buildings--Michigan--Ann Arbor.

scopecontent.p: The History of ISMRRD subseries includes information concerning the Benz Building, where ISMRRD was housed, the ISMRRD charter, and information describing the Institute itself. There is little relating to the process of establishing ISMRRD.

did.unittitle: "The Institute for the Study of Mental Retardation: An Overview," 1968

scopecontent.p: The files in the Accreditation Standards subseries include descriptions of ISMRRD's program and administration as well as a summary of the findings of the investigation of ISMRRD.
The Administrative Staff subseries is divided into Action Steps, Agendas, Memoranda, Minutes, Personnel and Miscellanea.

The subseries Committees is one of the largest in the collection. The Committees included are the Administrative Committee, Clinical Services, Committee for Behavioral Research and Training in Retardation, Committee to Study Classification and Labeling in the Area of Learning Disabilities, Core Advisory Staff Committee, Curriculum, Executive, Institute Planning, Operating Committee, Physical Therapy Discontinuance Review Committee, Planning, Preliminary Examination, Program, Program Directors Advisory Committee, Subcommittee to Study the Development of a University-Affiliated Facility for the Mentally Retarded, Training and Education, and the University Steering Committee on Mental Health. Within each committee the papers are generally divided into agendas, memoranda, and minutes, except where there is only one folder of material, in which case the arrangement is strictly chronological.

scopecontent.p: The Conference Proceedings subseries consists of a number of printed and bound proceedings covering the year 1970-1979. It is probably not a complete set of all conferences with which ISMRRD was involved.

did.unittitle: May 15-16, 1970 "The Challenge of Mental Retardation in the Community"
June 11 November 9-10, 1970 "Guidelines for the Preparation of Support Personnel"
March 4-5, 1971 "Confrontation and Change: Community Problems of Mental Retardation and Developmental Disabilities
June 2, 1972 "Advocacy for the Legal and Human Rights of the Mentally Retarded"
October, 1972 "Solutions '72: A Regional Organizational Conference to Implement the Interagency Concept ..."
June 22, 1973 "Audiological Considerations with Acoustically and Visually Impaired Children"
February 4-5, 1974 "National Information Exchange Regarding Mental Retardation and Related Disabilities"
April 8-10, 1975 "The Gerontological Aspects of Mental Retardation"
April 24-25, 1979 "University-Affiliated Facilities: A Primary Resource in Improving Services for Developmentally Disabled Persons"

scopecontent.p: The subseries Correspondence and Miscellaneous Memoranda includes information on the administration of the institute and about some research projects. The researcher should note that much correspondence may also be found within other different series.

The Institute Review subseries documents two separate reviews of ISMRRD. One was done in 1978/79 when ISMRRD lost the financial support of the Maternal and Child Health Foundation. The second review was undertaken by the University of Michigan in 1982, and led to the closing of ISMRRD. The series is subdivided into Collected Information, Correspondence and Reports from the Review Committee, and the Institute's response (its correspondence, memoranda and publicity surrounding the decision).

The Miscellaneous Files subseries consists of a Memoranda of Agreement, Newsletters and Pamphlets, and Planning and Policies files (which includes the ISMRRD Policy Notebook), Reorganization, School of Education, School of Nursing, and Seminars and Courses.

did.unittitle: Contract (proposed) with Michigan Department of Mental

scopecontent.p: Projects, Proposals and Reports provides some documentation of projects supported by ISMRRD. A completed project includes both the proposal and the final report. Unfortunately, most of ISMRRD's projects are not fully documented. In many cases, only the reports survive. The files are arranged alphabetically by project title (where such exists) or by broad area of concern. The projects/areas included are Abstracts, Age and Aging, Cerebral Palsy, Clinical Services, Community Living, Education, Evaluation, ISMRRD, Mental Retardation, and Training. Further material concerning projects may be found in the Research Files (boxes 8-18).

scopecontent.p: The subseries, Site Visit, fairly completely documents the visit of Maternal and Child Health personnel after ISMRRD appealed this group's earlier rejection of its application for grant money. The visit took place in 1980. The subseries is divided into Correspondence, Handouts, Memoranda and Results.

did.unittitle: "Survey of Michigan Rehabilitation Facilities: Implications for the Developmentally Disabled"

scopecontent.p: The Research Files series is arranged alphabetically by the title of the project. Researchers should not look to these files for detailed information or reports on the projects. Rather, these files contain a disparate assortment of information, correspondence and memoranda.

did.unittitle: Special Education Through Simulation and Consultation
Technical Assistance to Institutional Reform Plan
Washtenaw Intermediate School District Community Classroom
Wayne County Intermediate School District In-Service

scopecontent.p: The Continuing Education series (boxes 19-48) primarily consists of materials relating to conferences, workshops and seminars either sponsored by ISMRRD or pertaining to the field of mental retardation. This series is arranged chronologically, except for boxes 46 and 47, which are broken down into Activities, Budget, Description, Forms, Policies and Procedures, and Miscellanea. These are followed by a number of ISMRRD publications, extending into box 48.

The Audio-Visual materials series includes photographs, slide-tape presentations, and videotapes relating to the Institute’s work; also copies of historic photos of the Institute’s building, formerly the Ann Arbor Organ Works and Benz (Allmendinger) Building.
